author: Ben Cohen
title: How Tara and Johnny Became NBC’s Biggest Stars
text:
The most incisive, most engaging and maybe even the best sports broadcasters on television wear bedazzled headsets.
Tara Lipinski and Johnny Weir are still fashionable. They are still funny. They are still every bit as fabulous as they were in Sochi four years ago. They were such a success in their cable debut that NBC promoted the pair simply known as Tara and Johnny to become the network’s lead figure-skating analysts for its primetime telecasts from Pyeongchang—the voices of perhaps the Winter Olympics’ premier event.
...
